body: ### Problem When I open neovim with extui enabled, I press :h to open help while being in oil.nvim buffer, I have autocommand setup to open oil.nvim preview and I have autocomplete in cmdline, when I press any cmdline command neovim crashes on this assertion. Yes its fairly specific but if I disable any of: oil.nvim autocmd that throws error, nvim extui, cmdline autocomplete using autocmd it stops so I think it might be related to multiline error message popping up while opening cmdline with multiple windows open maybe? Screenshots: After `:h`: After starting to write `:q`: ### Steps to reproduce I can consistently reproduce it with my dotfiles: https://github.com/deathbeam/dotfiles/tree/master/nvim/.config/nvim But other than what I said above I wasnt able to narrow it down more. Here is extui enable: https://github.com/deathbeam/dotfiles/blob/af693d7db80794522be4dfda93e2b4b8cc3f90be/nvim/.config/nvim/lua/config/ui.lua#L13 Here is oil autocmd: https://github.com/deathbeam/dotfiles/blob/af693d7db80794522be4dfda93e2b4b8cc3f90be/nvim/.config/nvim/lua/config/ui.lua#L86 And here is the cmdline autocomplete: https://github.com/deathbeam/myplugins.nvim/blob/dc0af1afddf6a0801dc6940b7d2ee4a338bdd677/lua/myplugins/cmdcomplete.lua#L14 ### Expected behavior No crash (or no fail on assert at least, I assume the assert is there for a reason and this should not happen) ### Nvim version (nvim -v) NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1099+gbcf952e85f ### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same? no extui there so cant reproduce ### Operating system/version Linux archlinux 6.16.1-arch1-1.1-g14 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Fri, 22 Aug 2025 06:17:23 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux ### Terminal name/version alacritty 0.15.1 (0c405d53) ### $TERM environment variable tmux-256color ### Installation source (RelWithDebInfo)
